db:abstract.db:para: The QAbstractTransition class is the base class of transitions between QAbstractState objects.
This class was introduced in Qt 4.6.

db:listitem.db:para: QAbstractTransition is part of State Machine Classes

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: The QAbstractTransition class is the abstract base class of transitions between states (QAbstractState objects) of a QStateMachine. QAbstractTransition is part of The State Machine Framework.

The sourceState() function returns the source of the transition. The targetStates() function returns the targets of the transition. The machine() function returns the state machine that the transition is part of.
The triggered() signal is emitted when the transition has been triggered.
Transitions can cause animations to be played. Use the addAnimation() function to add an animation to the transition.

db:section.db:title: Subclassing
db:section.db:para: The eventTest() function is called by the state machine to determine whether an event should trigger the transition. In your reimplementation you typically check the event type and cast the event object to the proper type, and check that one or more properties of the event meet your criteria.
The onTransition() function is called when the transition is triggered; reimplement this function to perform custom processing for the transition.

db:section.db:title: enum QAbstractTransition::TransitionType
db:section.db:para: This enum specifies the kind of transition. By default, the type is an external transition.

db:td.db:para: Any state that is the source state of a transition (which is not a target-less transition) is left, and re-entered when necessary.
If the target state of a transition is a sub-state of a compound state, and that compound state is the source state, an internal transition will not leave the source state.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] sourceState : QState* const
db:section.db:para: This property holds the source state (parent) of this transition

db:section.db:title: targetState : QAbstractState*
db:section.db:para: This property holds the target state of this transition

If a transition has no target state, the transition may still be triggered, but this will not cause the state machine's configuration to change (i.e. the current state will not be exited and re-entered).

db:note.db:para: This is a private signal. It can be used in signal connections but cannot be emitted by the user.

db:section.db:title: targetStates : QList<QAbstractState*>
db:section.db:para: This property holds the target states of this transition
If multiple states are specified, all must be descendants of the same parallel group state.

db:note.db:para: This is a private signal. It can be used in signal connections but cannot be emitted by the user.

db:section.db:title: transitionType : TransitionType
db:section.db:para: indicates whether this transition is an internal transition, or an external transition.

Internal and external transitions behave the same, except for the case of a transition whose source state is a compound state and whose target(s) is a descendant of the source. In such a case, an internal transition will not exit and re-enter its source state, while an external one will.
By default, the type is an external transition.

db:section.db:title: QAbstractTransition::QAbstractTransition(QState *sourceState = Q_NULLPTR)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a new QAbstractTransition object with the given sourceState.

db:section.db:title: [virtual noexcept] QAbstractTransition::~QAbstractTransition()
db:section.db:para: Destroys this transition.

db:section.db:title: void QAbstractTransition::addAnimation(QAbstractAnimation *animation)
db:section.db:para: Adds the given animation to this transition. The transition does not take ownership of the animation.

db:section.db:title: QList<QAbstractAnimation *> QAbstractTransition::animations() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the list of animations associated with this transition, or an empty list if it has no animations.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual protected] bool QAbstractTransition::event(QEvent *e)
db:section.db:para: Reimplements: QObject::event(QEvent *e).

db:section.db:title: [pure virtual protected] bool QAbstractTransition::eventTest(QEvent *event)
db:section.db:para: This function is called to determine whether the given event should cause this transition to trigger. Reimplement this function and return true if the event should trigger the transition, otherwise return false.

db:section.db:title: QStateMachine *QAbstractTransition::machine() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the state machine that this transition is part of, or 0 if the transition is not part of a state machine.

db:section.db:title: [pure virtual protected] void QAbstractTransition::onTransition(QEvent *event)
db:section.db:para: This function is called when the transition is triggered. The given event is what caused the transition to trigger. Reimplement this function to perform custom processing when the transition is triggered.

db:section.db:title: void QAbstractTransition::removeAnimation(QAbstractAnimation *animation)
db:section.db:para: Removes the given animation from this transition.

db:section.db:title: void QAbstractTransition::setTargetState(QAbstractState *target)
db:section.db:para: Sets the target state of this transition.

db:section.db:title: void QAbstractTransition::setTargetStates(const QList<QAbstractState *> &targets)
db:section.db:para: Sets the target states of this transition to be the given targets.

db:section.db:title: void QAbstractTransition::setTransitionType(QAbstractTransition::TransitionType type)
db:section.db:para: Sets the type of the transition to type.

db:section.db:title: QState *QAbstractTransition::sourceState() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the source state of this transition, or 0 if this transition has no source state.

db:section.db:title: QAbstractState *QAbstractTransition::targetState() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the target state of this transition, or 0 if the transition has no target.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.4] void QAbstractTransition::targetStateChanged()
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the targetState property is changed.

db:note.db:para: This is a private signal. It can be used in signal connections but cannot be emitted by the user.

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 5.4.

db:section.db:title: QList<QAbstractState *> QAbstractTransition::targetStates() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the target states of this transition, or an empty list if this transition has no target states.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.4] void QAbstractTransition::targetStatesChanged()
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the targetStates property is changed.

db:note.db:para: This is a private signal. It can be used in signal connections but cannot be emitted by the user.

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 5.4.

db:section.db:title: QAbstractTransition::TransitionType QAbstractTransition::transitionType() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the type of the transition.

db:section.db:title: void QAbstractTransition::triggered()
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the transition has been triggered (after onTransition() has been called).

db:note.db:para: This is a private signal. It can be used in signal connections but cannot be emitted by the user.
